text: Cutting edge : expression of the NF of activated T cells in eosinophils : regulation by <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

We report that <extra_id_0> NF-AT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NF-AT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are expressed cytoplasmically in resting eosinophils , whereas <extra_id_0> NF-AT2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NF-AT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> have not been seen .

Likewise , <extra_id_0> NF-AT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and <extra_id_0> NF-AT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA have been detected in resting eosinophils , and their levels can be significantly up-regulated by the Th2 - associated cytokines <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
There is no detectable NF-AT protein expression in the nuclei of resting eosinophils .
However NF-ATs appear in the nuclei of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - , <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - , or ionomycin - stimulated eosinophils .

Only <extra_id_0> NF-AT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NF-AT4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but not <extra_id_0> NF-AT2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> NF-AT3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , have translocated into the nuclei in <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - or <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated eosinophils .

These findings delineate a novel pathway in the cytokine network in which Th2 lymphocytes " control " eosinophils via the release of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and activation of NF-AT in eosinophils .
The findings also suggest that a later feedback " talking " may exist between eosinophils and Th2 lymphocytes .
